D. M. HOLMES/cw/280 XSL 84 PRODUCT RECOMMENDATION
_D, LEWIS
C. D. WHITE
M. M. MATTESON P. J. TICHE M. L .. REYNOLDS
J. H. SEXS IONE H. L. SPRIGGS.
DATE_ JANUARY 19, 1970
At the last NPCC meeting, the Committee discussed the possibility of adopt- ing an untested KSL 84 improvement candidate. The incent is to have an improved formulation which can be produced immediately to coincide with the February ad campaign.
We believe a modest increase in menthol content (0.36 to 0.40%) provides Improvement. Therefore, we propose KSL 84 at 0.40% menthol be adopted without testing.
Three experimental KSL 84 will soon be tested against the current product as potential improvements. Original plans called for cop. lines in early January with possible produce change in time for February's"accelerated advertising campaign. However, recent cigarette rejections delay results to mid March or later.
Two of the three experimental products are quite different from KSL 84. Both use KSL 99 casing (much heavier) , higher menthol and a flavor (KSL 84 has none). Adopting either of these two prior to CPT results would represent a major risk.
A third experimental candidate Is simply current KSL 84 ot 0.40% menthol (now 0.36%). Increased menthol affect# KSL 84 smoke quality to a lesser degree than flavorings or heavier casinga.
Although small, the effect is a positive one. Higher menthol brings the . balance of menthol and tobacco sensations more in line with the parent brand, At ies current level, XSL 84 is tobacco dominant, particularly in the case of aged products.
D. M. H.
NOTICE IF THE FILM IMAGE IS LESS CLEAR THAN THIS NOTICE. IT IS DUE TO THE QUALITY OF THE DOCUMENT BEING FILNED.

cells.content: D. M. HOLMES/cw/280 XSL 84 PRODUCT RECOMMENDATION

paragraphs.content: 5 A WAL LIAMSON TURACCO COREIA& TIO+ INTERNAL CORRESPONDENCE
D. M. HOLMES/cw/280 XSL 84 PRODUCT RECOMMENDATION
M. M. MATTESON P. J. TICHE M. L .. REYNOLDS
J. H. SEXS IONE H. L. SPRIGGS.

At the last NPCC meeting, the Committee discussed the possibility of adopt- ing an untested KSL 84 improvement candidate. The incent is to have an improved formulation which can be produced immediately to coincide with the February ad campaign.
We believe a modest increase in menthol content (0.36 to 0.40%) provides Improvement. Therefore, we propose KSL 84 at 0.40% menthol be adopted without testing.

Three experimental KSL 84 will soon be tested against the current product as potential improvements. Original plans called for cop. lines in early January with possible produce change in time for February's"accelerated advertising campaign. However, recent cigarette rejections delay results to mid March or later.

Two of the three experimental products are quite different from KSL 84. Both use KSL 99 casing (much heavier) , higher menthol and a flavor (KSL 84 has none). Adopting either of these two prior to CPT results would represent a major risk.
A third experimental candidate Is simply current KSL 84 ot 0.40% menthol (now 0.36%). Increased menthol affect# KSL 84 smoke quality to a lesser degree than flavorings or heavier casinga.

Although small, the effect is a positive one. Higher menthol brings the . balance of menthol and tobacco sensations more in line with the parent brand, At ies current level, XSL 84 is tobacco dominant, particularly in the case of aged products.
NOTICE IF THE FILM IMAGE IS LESS CLEAR THAN THIS NOTICE. IT IS DUE TO THE QUALITY OF THE DOCUMENT BEING FILNED.
